jobDescription: Job Description:TrueCar is seeking to add an Site Reliability Engineer to our technology team. This role is a client facing, hands on engineering position, delivering guidance and advice to the client organization regarding application integration, DevOps, RDBMS and NoSQL, networking, virtualization, storage and security. WHAT YOU'LL DOWork with software engineers, data engineers, data scientists, and infrastructure engineers (DevOps) to help define, build, optimize, and support the applications running on our infrastructureDesign and implement automated data replication processes and policies to enable development teams and cost savings. Elasticsearch indices, S3 buckets, PostgreSQL databases, HBase tables from one cluster to another--you name it, someone probably wants it.Evaluate and vet new technologies for reliability, cost effectiveness, and maintainabilityDesign and implement solutions for key pieces of infrastructure around deployment, monitoring, alerting, data storage, and securityContinually improve the state of our shared infrastructure and toolingRevisit existing applications and infrastructure to suggest improvements and optimizationsBuild working relationships across the organization, at all levelsDefine best practices with excellent written documentationParticipate in on-call rotation with other engineers and developersWHAT YOU NEED:Software development experience with one or more of: Python, Ruby, Java, or ScalaExperience with relational databases such as PostgreSQL, MySQL, or Microsoft SQL Server.Experience with core Hadoop: HDFS, MapReduce, ZooKeeper, and YARNExperience with distributed/NoSQL databases: HBase, DynamoDB, Cassandra, or VoldemortSolid understanding of Linux systems and networking fundamentalsClear commitment to cloud. Track record with AWS preferred, but OpenStack, Google and Azure also of interestExcellent communication skills, written and spokenEvidence of self-learning and a commitment to personal developmentBachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, or equivalent experienceNICE TO HAVES:2+ years of experience as a software developer with MapReduce or SparkExperience with Elastic/ELK stack or Apache SolrExperience with extended Hadoop ecosystem: Hive, Pig, Oozie, Phoenix, HueExperience with scaling AWS services for data: Athena, Redshift, Glue, RDS (Aurora), Elastic MapReduce (EMR), DynamoDBExperience with Terraform or AWS CloudFormationExperience with one or configuration management tools such as Ansible, Salt, Chef, or PuppetExperience with Docker and/or Kubernetes Location(s): Santa Monica Offices  Associated topics: equipment, infrastructure, ip, maintenance, network, satellite, server, system engineer, system specialist, technician
